p: The antibacterial effect of CSEO is shown in Fig. 4. Totally, by increasing the concentration of EO, the growth of bacteria was reduced. At the highest level (8.00 mg.mL –1), the growth of S. aureus, E. coli, P. aeruginosa and K. pneumoniae decreased to 13%, 57%, 43% and 35%, respectively. Like the previously mentioned EOs, S. aureus was more susceptible than other examined bacteria. Reviewing the literature, MIC of CSEO against S. aureus, K. pneumoniae and E. coli was reported as 0.062, 0.25, and 0.12 mg.mL –1 ( 23). The related value for P. aeruginosa was 0.75 mg.mL –1 ( 24).
